newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordanian shares falter on bank stock selling.
newsitem.headline: Jordanian shares falter on bank stock selling.

text.p: Jordanian shares fell 0.18 percent on Tuesday in low volume hampered by poor institutional demand accompanied with selling pressure on two banks, brokers said.
The official Amman Financial Market (AFM) index shed 0.29 points to 156.56 points in low trade worth 422,115 dinars ($596,207 dinars).
Popular blue-chip stock which had posted modest price rises since Saturday on the back of sustained institutional demand saw gains eroded across the board.
Selling pressure on two banks, which were among the few stocks actively traded on Tuesday, helped sour sentiment and drag prices lower in thin trade.
Both Jordan Gulf Bank and Middle East Investment Bank sustained a similar 0.04 dinar drop to 0.85 dinars and 1.05 dinars respectively.
Jordan National Bank which relisted last week after merging with the Business Bank, also shed 0.01 dinars to 2.04 dinars in 44,028 dinars worth of trade.
Only Arab Bank, which was the busiest stock traded on Tuesday, rose a modest 0.5 dinars to 263 dinars in trade worth 84,060 dinars.
Overall only four shares rose on Tuesday and 29 fell, while another ten traded but closed unchanged.
The private Pearl Index of the 45 most-traded shares on the exchange shed 0.32 percent to 82.61 points, still 0.94 percent down from the start of the year.
